definition: to meet by chance (usually with misfortune)/classifier for events: time, turn, incident
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: Police in flak jackets are patrolling the districts hit by the violence.
sentences.chinese: 身穿防彈衣的警察正在遭受暴力攻擊的地段巡邏。

sentences.english: Everything you have ever known Kratos, will now suffer because of your sacrilege .
sentences.chinese: 你要知道你現在所遭受的一切是來自於你的褻瀆。

sentences.english: Patricia Neal raised money for children and adults who had suffered brain injuries.
sentences.chinese: 帕特里夏尼爾誰提出的兒童和成年人遭受腦損傷的錢。

sentences.english: The region is seriously influenced by natural diease.
sentences.chinese: 這個地區遭受了嚴重的自然災害。

sentences.english: Yellow to porch suffer Hong Kong police, who had to go to taking home for help.
sentences.chinese: 黃以軒遭受香港警方通緝，只好前去去晏家求助。

sentences.english: If we don't remove the tooth, the 2)gum may get infected.
sentences.chinese: 如果不拔，牙齦有可能遭受感染。

sentences.english: Though brutally mistreated, slaves were not cheap.
sentences.chinese: 雖然遭受殘酷虐待，黑奴並不便宜。

sentences.english: You must realize that one day your existence will suffer the same fate.
sentences.chinese: 你必須意識到總有一天你的存在也會遭受相同的命運。

sentences.english: Great supplies were sent to the disaster-hit area.
sentences.chinese: 大量的給養被運送到遭受災難襲擊的地區。

sentences.english: This area is hit by an average of about 5 hailstorms a year.
sentences.chinese: 這個地區平均每年遭受大約五次冰雹襲擊。

sentences.english: FAO estimated 37 percent of children suffered from stunting.
sentences.chinese: 聯合國糧農組織估計有37%的兒童遭受發育障礙。

sentences.english: Almost half of children regularly breathe air polluted by tobacco smoke.
sentences.chinese: 近半數兒童經常呼吸遭受菸草煙霧污染的空氣。

sentences.english: Jacob suffered severe threshings and grindings.
sentences.chinese: 雅各也曾遭受過不少難忍的磨練。

sentences.english: Menzies suffered from a severe personality disorder but was not insane.
sentences.chinese: 孟席斯遭受了嚴重的人格障礙，但沒有精神錯亂。

sentences.english: She says people caught in the earthquake are unable to cook and require ready-to-eat foods.
sentences.chinese: 她還說遭受地震的人們不能做飯，需要的是方便食物。

sentences.english: The enemy warships were disengaged from the battle after suffering heavy casualties.
sentences.chinese: 在遭受慘重傷亡後，敵艦退出了海戰。

definition: to receive (praise, an education, punishment etc)/to be ...ed (praised, educated, punished etc)
to endure/to suffer/to be subjected to
to inflict heavy losses/to inflict serious damage
to meet by chance (usually with misfortune)/classifier for events: time, turn, incident
to hit/to strike/to attack/to crack down on sth/blow/(psychological) shock/percussion (music)
to recruit (followers)/to scout for (talent etc)/to incur/to lead to
